REMARKS: A table containing addresses of Persons.
alle waarnemingen van de soorten die in de annex 2.1 van de ordonnantie zijn opgenomen
alle waarnemingen van de soorten die in de annex 2.2 van de ordonnantie zijn opgenomen
alle waarnemingen van de soorten die in de annex 2.3 van de ordonnantie zijn opgenomen
alle waarnemingen van de soorten die in de annex 2.4 van de ordonnantie zijn opgenomen
A table listing all the behaviors, based on the Natuurpunt waarnemingen.be terminology and extended to fit the needs of BIM. This table has no relationships and is only used as a library.

A table listing all lifestages a particular taxon can have, based on the Natuurpunt waarnemingen.be terminology and extended to fit the needs of BIM. Examples: butterflies can have caterpillars, flies larvae, birds pulli etc.
A table listing all annexes currently existing. Annexes are appendices to nature conservation legislation and contain a list of species having a certain conservancy priority.
20150807 Lijst met alle soorten van Annex II.1 van de Ordonnantie 20120301
20150807 Lijst met alle soorten van Annex II.2 van de Ordonnantie 20120301
20150807 Lijst met alle soorten van Annex II.3 van de Ordonnantie 20120301
20150807 Lijst met alle soorten van Annex II.4 van de Ordonnantie 20120301

A table grouping several Taxon according to informal groups as used on waarnemingen.be. For instance, Insects are separated into Heteroptera, Coleoptera, Diptera, Moths, Butterflies, Ants, Bees & Wasps & finally All other insects.
A table listing on which original information the calculation of a coordinate was based.

A table containing datasets of species occurence observations. Not all occurence observations need to be in a dataset. They can be digital (coming from another dataset, excel table,...) or digitized (from old museum collections for instance, and entered by BIM themselves). However, it is estimated that nearly all datasets (will) have a digital origin.
A table listing all possible origins a species can have according to species.be. Examples: introduced, native,...
A table listing how observed occurences established themselves. This table has no relationships and is only used as a library. Values are: escape, managed.

A table containing species observation events. Two events are the same when they have the same protocol, the same date, the same fieldnumber, the same habitat, AND lead to the same actual species occurence observations. Occurences can be grouped together into Events, but this is not a necessity. Individual Occurences that don't have a specific samplingProtocol can correspond to a single Event each. Event is meant to group together Occurences that have been done in one single sampling sweep (bat transect, plant square,...).
A table listing geographic regions to use with Legislation.
A table listing all the habitats, based on the Natuurpunt waarnemingen.be terminology and extended to fit the needs of BIM. This table has no relationships and is only used as a library.

A table listing all the identifiable species regarded as taxonomic units (including both valid names and synonyms) plus all the entities that are not regarded as taxonomic units; for example collective species, cf. or aff.-identifications, wrongly spelled names... (we use collective species as a group noun for all these cases). Collective species can be species complexes that are hard to identify (no microscope) or impossible by morphological means alone. Such observations cannot be identified down to the species level.
A table containing some identification details of exactly one species occurence.
A table listing all possible statuses used to validate the observations of lay people, based on the Natuurpunt waarnemingen.be terminology, and extended to fit the needs of BIM.

TABLE_CAT: Values are: Goedgekeurd op basis van bewijsmateriaal, Goedgekeurd op basis van expertoordeel, Goedgekeurd op basis van kennisregels, In behandeling, Niet te oordelen, Onbehandeld, BIM-intern besproken, BIM-onbehandeld

REMARKS: A table listing all the possible ways the observer has decided the given value to be the most accurate given the situation. Values are: gezien niet geteld, exact aantal, schatting, geëxtrapoleerd
A table listing all nature conservation legislation. Example: European Habitats Directive.
A table containing points in space, together with supporting data. The chance two entries are identical is negligible.
A table providing extra metrics on an observed occurence. Examples: key: "forofyt"; value:"Ulmus sp.", key:"snow coverage"; value:">50%".
A table listing all media associated with a Taxon.

A table containing motives to make species observation events. Motives needn't necessarily lead to actual species observation events and can stand on their own. A common motive is a complaint of a civilian, for example "fox smell".
A table that lists all possible ways a Motive reached BIM-IBGE.
A table listing all motive types. Values are: klacht, vraag.
A table containing Municipalities, including those of the Brussels Capital Region.
A table containing all natural persons that have recorded and identified species occurence observations .

TABLE_CAT: Nb: this joins DwC recordedBy and identifiedBy.

REMARKS: A table containing all Observers that can enter data in the manual entry interface.
A table containing species occurence observations.
column6: Two occurences are identical if they are pertaining to the same species, in exactly the same configuration (sex,...), on the same place, by the same person, and during the same event. An identical observation may be recorded more than once in different datasets.

REMARKS: materialized view van passer domesticus waarnemingen sinds 1 januari 2000

A table listing all the reproductive conditions, based on the needs of BIM. This table has no relationships and is only used as a library. Values are: non-breeding, possibly breeding, probably breeding, certainly breeding.

TABLE_CAT: Lijst met alle soorten en hun toegekende annex voor de SBZ1 (natura 2000)
Lijst met alle soorten en hun toegekende annex voor de SBZ2 (natura 2000)
Lijst met alle soorten en hun toegekende annex voor de SBZ3 (natura 2000)

REMARKS: A table listing all the possible genders. Examples: unknowable, undetermined, female, male.
A table that assigns one or more annexes to one or more species. Examples: Alytes obstetricans is on Annex 4 of the European Habitats Directive.

A table listing all the valid and accepted taxa that occur in Belgium. Synonyms are not included. Taxa range from varieties, subspecies, species to phyla. It does not contain informal taxa or collective taxa. It contains the same number of entries as species.be.
A table listing all possible taxonomic statuses according to species.be. Examples: accepted, synonym,...
A table listing all possible taxon ranks according to species.be. Examples: species, genus, family etc.
